byline.contributor: Matt Apuzzo reported from Washington, and John Eligon from Kansas City, Mo.
byline.original: By MATT APUZZO and JOHN ELIGON

abstract: Justice Dept and Ferguson, Mo, reach agreement aimed at overhauling city's justice system; deal, known as consent decree, stems from criticism of city's courts and police in wake of 2014 police shooting of black teenager Michael Brown; if approved, agreement will bring sweeping changes and spare city a long and involved civil rights court battle.

headline.print_headline: Justice Department and Ferguson Reach Agreement on Police
headline.main: Department of Justice Reaches Agreement With Ferguson

snippet: The pact, which requires City Council approval, seeks to end unlawful arrests and ensure that the courts are independent of prosecutors.
lead_paragraph: The pact, which requires City Council approval, seeks to end unlawful arrests and ensure that the courts are independent of prosecutors.
